title: Non-degenerate near-parabolic renormalization. (arXiv:2210.06647v2 [math.DS] UPDATED)
description: Invariant classes under parabolic and near-parabolic renormalization have proved extremely useful for studying the dynamics of polynomials. The first such class was introduced by Inou-Shishikura to study quadratic polynomials; their argument has been extended to the unicritical cubic case by Yang. Recently, Ch\'eritat has constructed new invariant classes for these renormalizations, general enough to be applied to unicritical polynomials of arbitrary degree. Usually the parabolic and near-parabolic renormalizations are only considered for maps which have a fixed point with multiplier close to $1$, though it is well-known that similar phenomena occur when the multiplier is close to any root of unity. In this paper we define the parabolic and near-parabolic renormalization operators in the general setting, and use Ch\'eritat's argument to produce invariant classes for these operators.
dc:creator: Alex Kapiamba
